org.freezedry.persistence.keyvalue

Interface KeyValueBuilder

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractKeyValueBuilder, BasicKeyValueBuilder

    public interface KeyValueBuilder
    Interface that defines what a KeyValueBuilder builder should perform. The KeyValueBuilder takes a semantic model and flattens the structure into a List of key-value pairs. The specifics of how the keys and values are represented is determined by the implementing classes.

      • setRenderers

        void setRenderers(java.util.Map<java.lang.Class<?>,PersistenceRenderer> renderers)
        Sets the mapping of Classes to their PersistenceRenderers.
        Parameters:
        renderers - The mapping of Classes to their PersistenceRenderers.

      • putRenderer

        PersistenceRenderer putRenderer(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                              PersistenceRenderer renderer)
        Puts an association between a Class and a PersistenceRenderer into the mapping. This call replaces existing associations, in that case, returning the previous PersistenceRenderer.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The Class with which to associate the PersistenceRenderer
        renderer - The PersistenceRenderer to be associated with the specified Class
        Returns:
        the PersistenceRenderer that was previously associated with the specified Class or null if no association existed.

      • removeRenderer

        PersistenceRenderer removeRenderer(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
        Removes the Class from any association with the PersistenceRenderer. Use this method if you think that the specified Class is above any such undesirable associations.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The Class to remove
        Returns:
        the PersistenceRenderer that was associated with the specified Class so that it can be dealt with properly, or null if no such association existed, and this was a false accusation.

      • setArrayRenderer

        void setArrayRenderer(PersistenceRenderer renderer)
        Sets the PersistenceRenderer to be used for renderering and parsing arrays
        Parameters:
        renderer - The PersistenceRenderer to be used for renderering and parsing arrays

      • getArrayRenderer

        PersistenceRenderer getArrayRenderer()
        Returns:
        the PersistenceRenderer to be used for renderering and parsing arrays

      • buildKeyValuePairs

        java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>> buildKeyValuePairs(InfoNode rootInfoNode)
        The entry point for building the List of key-value pairs from the semantic model, through a recursive algorithm (buildKeyValuePairs(InfoNode, String, List). Effectively, this will flatten the tree into a list of key-value pairs.
        Parameters:
        rootInfoNode - The root InfoNode of the semantic model
        Returns:
        the List of key-value pairs
        See Also:
        buildKeyValuePairs(InfoNode, String, List)

      • buildKeyValuePairs

        void buildKeyValuePairs(InfoNode infoNode,
                      java.lang.String key,
                      java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>> keyValues)
        The recursive algorithm for flattening the semantic model into a List of key-value pairs.
        Parameters:
        infoNode - The current node in the semantic model (InfoNode) for processing.
        key - The current key, which has accumulated the parents persistence names as part of the flattening
        keyValues - The current list of key-values to which to add the ones created in this algorithm.

      • createKeyValuePairs

        void createKeyValuePairs(InfoNode infoNode,
                       java.lang.String key,
                       java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>> keyValues,
                       boolean isWithholdPersitName)
        Creates the actual key-value pair, though for compound nodes, it calls back its calling method, buildKeyValuePairs(InfoNode, String, List).
        Parameters:
        infoNode - The current node in the semantic model (InfoNode) for processing.
        key - The current key, which has accumulated the parents persistence names as part of the flattening
        keyValues - The current list of key-values to which to add the ones created in this algorithm.
        isWithholdPersitName - true if the current persistence name should not be added to the key; false otherwise. This parameter allows PersistenceRenderers to suppress the persistence name when it is appropriate. For example, in a List of String, you may not want to at "String" to the key.

      • getSeparator

        java.lang.String getSeparator()
        Returns:
        The separator between the flattened key elements. For example, suppose that a Division has a List of Person objects, called people. The the key for a person's first name may be of the form: Division.people.Person[2].firstName, or Division:people:Person[2]:firstName. The "." and the ":" are separators.

      • getRenderer

        PersistenceRenderer getRenderer(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
        Returns the renderer for the specified Class or null if the specified Class doesn't have an associated renderer. The returned renderer will either be the renderer associated with:
        • the specified Class
        • the renderer associated with the closest ancestor
        • null if neither of the previous two are found
        Parameters:
        clazz - The Class for which to return the renderer.
        Returns:
        the renderer for the specified Class or null if the specified Class.

      • setSeparator

        void setSeparator(java.lang.String separator)
        The separator between the flattened key elements. For example, suppose that a Division has a List of Person objects, called people. The the key for a person's first name may be of the form: Division.people.Person[2].firstName, or Division:people:Person[2]:firstName. The "." and the ":" are separators.
        Parameters:
        separator - The separator

      • setShowFullKey

        void setShowFullKey(boolean isShowFullKey)
        When set to true, the full key is persisted. So for example, normally, if there is a List of String called names, then the key will have the form names[i]. When this is set to true, then the List would have a key of the form names[i].String
        Parameters:
        isShowFullKey - true means that the full key will be persisted; false is default

      • isShowFullKey

        boolean isShowFullKey()
        When set to true, the full key is persisted. So for example, normally, if there is a List of String called names, then the key will have the form names[i]. When this is set to true, then the List would have a key of the form names[i].String
        Returns:
        true means that the full key will be persisted; false is default

      • buildInfoNode

        InfoNode buildInfoNode(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                     java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> keyValues)
        Main entry point for building the semantic model from a list of key-value pairs and the target class.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The target class for the building of the semantic model
        keyValues - The key-value pairs
        Returns:
        The root InfoNode of the semantic model

      • buildInfoNode

        void buildInfoNode(InfoNode parentNode,
                 java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> keyValues)
        Recursively builds the semantic model. The keys in the key-value list should all have as their first element, the name found in the parentNode's persistence name.
        Parameters:
        parentNode - The node to which to add the child nodes
        keyValues - The list of key-value pairs. The first key element of every key should match the persistence name of the parent node.

      • createInfoNode

        void createInfoNode(InfoNode parentNode,
                  java.lang.String groupName,
                  java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> keyValues)
        Creates an InfoNode based on the group name and the specified key-value pairs. Part of the recursive algorithm to build the semantic model.
        Parameters:
        parentNode - The node to which to add the child nodes
        groupName - The name of the group that will appear as the persistence name
        keyValues - The list of key-value pairs. The first key element of every key should match the persistence name of the parent node.
        See Also:
        buildInfoNode(InfoNode, List)

      • getRootKey

        java.lang.String getRootKey(java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> keyValues,
                          java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
        Returns the root key. If the useClassAsRootKey default was set via the constructor or the #setRootKey(String) method, then it returns that root key. Otherwise, it pulls the first key element from each key, ensures that they are all the same, and then returns that root key.
        Parameters:
        keyValues - The list of key-value pairs
        Returns:
        the root key.
